Package mygame.multiplayer.services

Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
mygame.multiplayer.services.Scheduler
public final class Scheduler extends Object
Utility class for service-related operations.

  • Field Details

    • CLOCK_PERIOD_MILLIS

      static final int CLOCK_PERIOD_MILLIS
      The game clients and server's tick rate, in milliseconds. Connections, Monitors, etc. are run at this rate.

      It's tempting to make this number as small as possible, but if it's too small, the OS complains with a bunch of IO errors.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • repeat

      public static Service repeat(Runnable task)
      Run a task repeatedly in another thread.

      If the task throws an exception, the program will crash. This method is meant for mission-critical tasks that cannot not fail (e.g. the game's main loop).

      Returns a Service that can be used to stop the repetition. It, however, does not interrupt a task currently running.

      Parameters:
      task - the task to be run repeatedly
      Returns:
      a Service
      See Also:
      • Monitor

    • await

      public static <T> PublisherService<T> await(Supplier<T> task)
      Asynchronously wait for a task to finish.

      Returns a PublisherService that publishes the task's return value.

      Does not actually start the service. As normal, it only starts when a callback is attached.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the task's return type
      Parameters:
      task - the task to run
      Returns:
      a PublisherService

    • await

      public static PublisherService<Void> await(Runnable task)
      Asynchronously wait for a task to finish.

      Returns a PublisherService that triggers when the task finishes.

      Does not actually start the service. As normal, it only starts when a callback is attached.

      Parameters:
      task - the task to run
      Returns:
      a PublisherService

    • await

      public static PublisherService<Void> await(int durationMillis)
      Asynchronously wait for a given amount of time.

      Returns a PublisherService that triggers when the wait is over.

      Parameters:
      durationMillis - wait duration in milliseconds
      Returns:
      a PublisherService

    • wait

      public static <T> T wait(PublisherService<T> publisher)
      Blocks the current thread until a PublisherService publishes a value, then returns that value.

      If the service can publish multiple times, it will keep doing so in its own thread. This only waits until the first value is received.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the publisher's message type
      Parameters:
      publisher - a PublisherService
      Returns:
      the first value the publisher publishes

    • wait

      public static void wait(int durationMillis)
      Pause the current thread for a given amount of time.
      Parameters:
      durationMillis - the length of time in milliseconds
